repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Description:
* The adoption of Windows on ARM (WoA) devices is steadily increasing, yet many applications are still not natively available for this platform.
* GitHub Actions now offer native CI runners for Windows on ARM devices (windows-11-arm), enabling automated builds and testing.
* Currently, official neovim binaries are not provided for Windows ARM64 and thus users/developers were facing difficulties using popular neovim application natively.
* This PR introduces support for building neovim application on Windows ARM64, improving accessibility for developers and end users on this emerging platform.

Changes Proposed:
- Added windows arm64 job in GitHub CI to build windows on arm neovim binaries.
- Modified CMake packaging to include packaging windows on arm binaries.
- Modified env script to install and initialize vs setup for arm64 arch.

comment_data.body:
ignore case ?. idk if this is the right placement of `(?i)`, please confirm.
```suggestion
if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR MATCHES "(?i)^(arm64|aarch64)$")
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,6 @@
-if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR MATCHES "aarch64")
+if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR MATCHES "^(arm64|ARM64|aarch64)$")

comment_data.body: can the conditions check CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR instead of adding another flag?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,6 @@
-if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR MATCHES "aarch64")
+if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR MATCHES "^(arm64|ARM64|aarch64)$")
   set(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR arm64)
+  set(IS_ARM64 TRUE)

comment_data.body:
you really need to be careful about yaml. I would not be surprised if `"\w"` is treated like an escape. Don't use `\` slashes unless it is absolutely required. 

`\` are rarely required on Windows, despite everyone just automatically assuming that.

+      - name: Install Wix
+        run: |
+          Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://github.com/wixtoolset/wix3/releases/download/wix3141rtm/wix314-binaries.zip" -OutFile "wix314-binaries.zip"
+          Expand-Archive -Path "wix314-binaries.zip" -DestinationPath "C:/wix"
+          echo "C:\wix" >> $env:GITHUB_PATH
       - name: Build deps
         run: |
           cmake -S cmake.deps -B .deps -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=${{ needs.setup.outputs.build_type }}
           cmake --build .deps
-      - name: build package
+      - name: Build package
         run: |
-          cmake -B build -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=${{ needs.setup.outputs.build_type }}
+          cmake -B build -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=${{ needs.setup.outputs.build_type }} -DCMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR=${{ matrix.arch }}
           cmake --build build --target package
-      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
+      - name: Upload artifact
+        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
         with:
-          name: nvim-win64
+          name: ${{ matrix.arch == 'x86_64' && 'nvim-win-x64' || 'nvim-win-arm64' }}

comment_data.body: is there a "latest" variant of the windows arm runner ?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -132,27 +132,44 @@ jobs:
 
   windows:
     needs: setup
-    runs-on: windows-2022
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        include:
+          - runner: windows-latest
+            arch: x86_64
+            zip_name: nvim-win-x64.zip
+          - runner: windows-11-arm

comment_data.body: do not pass `CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR`, that is confusing. `CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR` is a *cmake-provided* name. The cmake logic should check that, because that's also what users will be using when building locally. The logic should check for whatever value cmake provides on Windows x64/arm64. There is no reason to override it here, cmake already will tell us an appropriate value (and we can use `MATCHES` as already discussed).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -132,27 +132,44 @@ jobs:
 
   windows:
     needs: setup
-    runs-on: windows-2022
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        include:
+          - runner: windows-latest
+            arch: x86_64
+            zip_name: nvim-win-x64.zip
+          - runner: windows-11-arm
+            arch: arm64
+            zip_name: nvim-win-arm64.zip
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.runner }}
     steps:
       - uses: actions/checkout@v5
         with:
           # Perform a full checkout #13471
           fetch-depth: 0
       - run: .github/scripts/env.ps1
+        env:
+          BUILD_ARCH: ${{ matrix.arch }}
+      - name: Install Wix
+        run: |
+          Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://github.com/wixtoolset/wix3/releases/download/wix3141rtm/wix314-binaries.zip" -OutFile "wix314-binaries.zip"
+          Expand-Archive -Path "wix314-binaries.zip" -DestinationPath "C:/wix"
+          echo "C:\wix" >> $env:GITHUB_PATH
       - name: Build deps
         run: |
           cmake -S cmake.deps -B .deps -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=${{ needs.setup.outputs.build_type }}
           cmake --build .deps
-      - name: build package
+      - name: Build package
         run: |
-          cmake -B build -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=${{ needs.setup.outputs.build_type }}
+          cmake -B build -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=${{ needs.setup.outputs.build_type }} -DCMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR=${{ matrix.arch }}

comment_data.body:
keep back-compat for now. save breaking changes for separate, isolated PRs.

```suggestion
    set(CPACK_PACKAGE_FILE_NAME "nvim-win64")
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -27,9 +27,13 @@ set(CPACK_RESOURCE_FILE_README ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/README.md)

-  set(CPACK_PACKAGE_FILE_NAME "nvim-win64")

+    set(CPACK_PACKAGE_FILE_NAME "nvim-win-arm64")
+  else()
+    set(CPACK_PACKAGE_FILE_NAME "nvim-win-x64")

instead of `zip_name` could we set `archive_name` and do something like this?

```suggestion
            build/${{ matrix.archive_name }}.msi
```

comment_regular_data.body: @justinmk Is there anything I am missing with this PR, not sure why this PR is not reviewed yet

> @justinmk Is there anything I am missing with this PR, not sure why this PR is not reviewed yet

definitely a nice improvement, just need to clean it up a bit

also, Windows CI is red? try rebasing
@justinmk looks like the suggestion given for detecting arm arch in cmake causing issues:

@justinmk the following piece of code is working fine for me and for all arm builds:
`if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR MATCHES "^(arm64|ARM64|aarch64)$")`
AI lied to me about `(?i)` , can forget that :)
@justinmk pushed few changes to get msi installer for windows arm64 and now the changes are minimal, hope now we comes to an end :))
I am really surprised by seeing CI failures from files which I have not even touched :<

> I am really surprised by seeing CI failures from files which I have not even touched :<

You touched the Windows build and Windows CI is failing to build. Focus on those CI jobs.

@justinmk I dont think my change is responsible for the build workflow crash. Looking at another run https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/17036837243, the same crashes occurred there as well.
wasmtime can be ignored, I was referring to `test / windows / windows (functional)` which was failing, but looks ok now.
One last quick comment then LGTM. Thanks for persisting (and testing on your fork), this will be a nice thing to have.

> One last quick comment then LGTM. Thanks for persisting (and testing on your fork), this will be a nice thing to have.

sure, thanks for your support :))

I started the release workflow: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/workflows/release.yml

please check that it does what you expect :) i.e. does the artifact run on windows arm?

> please check that it does what you expect :) i.e. does the artifact run on windows arm? Thanks for adding the support, I have validated the binaries on native windows arm device. The native application runs without any issues:
Git push to origin failed for release-0.11 with exitcode 1
